quest.name: The Fortunes of War
journal: Your work is far from finished, as Conrad knows.
objectives: Search the Fringes for remnants of the imperial army.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Did you see that, A'aba, Aulie? We did it!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> For a moment there, I didn't think I could do it...but then I did!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: One step at a time, one step at a time. Until we're on Zenos's doorstep!

dialogue.name: ANANTASOLDIER
dialogue.text: Ssso, you are indeed everything they sssay. The ssstuff of legends...

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: There's still a chance that some imperials are holed up inside the castellum. We'll need to search it top to bottom to be sure it's safe.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I want you to rendezvous with the main host. Keep your weapons at the ready─there's a chance you might come face–to–face with soldiers on the run en route.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: On second thought, it might be prudent for you to do a preemptive sweep of the region for soldiers that have gone to ground. We shouldn't afford them any time to regroup and launch a counterattack.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: When you've judged your work to be done, report to General Aldynn in Bittermill.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Just because we've won doesn't mean it's over yet. There're still enemies about, and a panicked soldier can kill you just as quick as a cool-headed one.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a desperate presence!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Don't come any closer!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Sod this! I'm not dying today!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Bull of Ala Mhigo has done it again. His assessment of Fordola's response was without error.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's a good thing M'naago got the flag flying when she did. Any longer and those imperials might have had us at their mercy...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Well met[GC Rank]. All's well at the bridge?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Good, good. The fighting has died down here too, as you can see.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Pipin left but a moment ago with a contingent of troops to occupy Velodyna. If and when the imperials return, they'll find us dug in behind their own walls.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I could not have hoped for a better outcome, General. Splendidly done.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Let's not get ahead of ourselves. It'll take more than one castellum to turn the tide.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: My men and I will deal with the remaining enemy forces. Scions, I bid you return to Commander Kemp and his men.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Delight not overmuch in victory─not when there are battles left to fight...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Our work here is finished. Our Resistance allies are waiting.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: From a stone bridge to a massive fortress... Garlean engineering never ceases to impress.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Now that we have taken control of Velodyna, there's nothing stopping us from marching east towards the Peaks.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If you're looking for Arenvald, I think he's with Pipin, searching the castellum for any remaining soldiers.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEGATEGUARD
dialogue.text: Velodyna belongs to the Alliance and the Resistance now. You may be assured that the imperials will never hold it again!

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: Back so soon? I suppose the General and his men had matters well in hand.

dialogue.name: CONRAD
dialogue.text: The vice marshal and his men showed up not long after you left. If the gods are good, there'll be no one left to fight...
